p: The albedo determines how much of the incoming shortwave radiation is reflected back to space. It has a particularly pronounced impact on temperature in regions that experience transitions between snow‐covered and snow‐free states over the course of the year (Ellis & Leathers, 1999). Changes in albedo caused by global warming can have important impacts locally (e.g., polar amplification; Graversen & Wang, 2009; Pithan & Mauritsen, 2014) and also in more extended regions (Hall, 2004).
